extendedInfo.description: Infinity Space is a game which reflects the incredible history of mankind to face the unknown. You will go into space in search of expanding humanity's achievements. Visit planets never before seen by human! Reach the longest distance that has been visited in the universe! Improve your spaceship to make new achievements! Escape the dangers of the universe: meteorites, solar rays, meteorites belts, black holes, enormous planets with incredible gravity. Key Features: - Explore universe in all directions ( not only one like other runners ) - The universe is alive, itâs in constant rotation besides having gravity. - Discover new planets for the glory of mankind. - Incredible space ships inspired in the greatest famous ships. - Upgrades your space ship for reach new goals. - The ship has amazing skills like a radar for detection of planets, shields and turbo effects. - 24 Amazing missions.

reviews.title: SUPER AWESOME GAME!!
reviews.comment: This game is GREAT!!! It is one of the BEST GAMES I\'ve played on my phone in a very long time!! If were able to I\'d rate it with 100000 STARS!!!! Great job on both graphics and playability!! The programmers have done an EXCELLENT JOB!!
reviews.author: Eric Brown

reviews.title: Smooth and challenging :)
reviews.comment: Its a really gr8 game with some challenging stuff but what we need is some support from u guys haha i mean some green revival gems will do to the work even if they work..add that fix some bugs and it will be a 5 star game.. Gr8 work & move on :D
reviews.author: empath dark

reviews.title: Good Potential
reviews.comment: Collision detection good (flown through many meteor tails), repetative meteors, asteroids, etc, must start from Earth always, very hard flying up or down, should show lives left, upgrades OK, becomes insanely hard without warning (faulty difficulty logic) but looks purdy and is addictive. And free!
reviews.author: Rod Williams

reviews.title: Fun, but..
reviews.comment: Needs an options menu, ability to pay for ad removal and a touch anywhere control method.
reviews.author: Jon Bowden

reviews.title: The best of space
reviews.comment: Try this if you like the starz and planets discover another lives in the infinity
reviews.author: Jose Gomez

reviews.title: Tedious controls
reviews.comment: Not my cup of tea. I don\'t like the controls and constantly dodging asteroids takes away the fun in my opinion.
reviews.author: Anthony Goodley

reviews.title: Alright
reviews.comment: I love the game good graphics and it honestly can pass the time. I would totally recommend for any long trip.   Two issues that bother me is that A) there is negative distance which effects high score so if i travel to the left 1000units then back right 200 units my score is 800 which is wrong I traveled 1200 it makes it more worth killing myself then completing missions. B) Power ups don\'t combined if I get a 4x and 2x after I get only the 2x power up. Oh it also restarts if a call comes in while playing.
reviews.author: Coury Richards

reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.comment: Real good game. It pretty much starts off difficult & just gets impossible as u advance. The analog stick controller at the bottom left is not the best. But still this game is thoroughly good
reviews.author: Andree Delgado

reviews.title: Cool, but...
reviews.comment: Indeed, it\'s cool game, but I have a problem. When I tap a button to back to main menu from game, nothing is happening. I have to close game by task manager. I have Samsung Galaxy Mini 2. If that problem should be solved, I give 5 stars. But still it\'s good game : )
reviews.author: Karol Wyciszkiewicz

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.comment: This is one of my favorite time wasters. Leave earth and explore the universe. The game play is simple yet addiction.
reviews.author: Stephen Mullendore

reviews.title: Needs improvements
reviews.comment: Its a good game but should have amor for amount of hits u can take before diying a weapon for meterods and more stuff to do
reviews.author: Denver Samaroo

reviews.title: Great fun, but rough around the edges.
reviews.comment: I love this kind of game. I would just like to be able to pay a fee to get rid of ads. Also please improve the performance/ loading times.
reviews.author: Anthony Rieser

reviews.title: Well made!
reviews.comment: Highly polished, everything isn\'t based completely in purchasing in game items, animations are smooth, top notch work
reviews.author: Samuel Kwak

reviews.title: Great game!
reviews.comment: Great and fun game! Only suggestion I have is to maybe add some more upgrades (something like a lazer weapon to blow up astroids) and ship skins like the enterprise would be awesome. Keep up the great work!
reviews.author: Nick Cella

reviews.title: Repetitive
reviews.comment: Once you \"discover\" your first couple of planets, this game turns into a repetitive frustration-fest that offers nothing new or even evolving in terms of game play. No thanks. Uninstalled.
reviews.author: Buddy Morgan

reviews.title: Good game
reviews.comment: Loving this game very addictive but what new ship is avalible? I already had 5 before the update?
reviews.author: Aaron Young

reviews.title: Just amazing
reviews.comment: It\'s really interesting a little hard to navigate but then so is space!
reviews.author: Michael Gore

reviews.comment: Games are to be fun, not impossible like this game. Didnt put much thought into the controls. To much stuff in space to destroy craft. Impossible to fly up n down for very long without hitting something due to screen not giving enough space to see whats coming\tNot fun, to complex for phone game.
reviews.author: John Moseley

reviews.title: To Infinity and Beyond
reviews.comment: Keep it coming...need new updates~! Great game!
reviews.author: Scott Wayne

reviews.title: On the right track.
reviews.comment: The game makes a fun arcade experience, but I feel like a couple minor changes might make it a little more spacey, without sacrificing playability. The biggest thing that I think would be cool is if the ship didn\'t slow down when you stop firing the engine, and would keep drifting in the direction it\'s moving. Then if you want to stop or change directions, you would fire in a new direction. With sparser debris I think the challenge level could be maintained.
reviews.author: Derik McKenzie
